file_content.text: Major. Now that you've reached our Voss outpost, let's begin your briefing.
Voss was first discovered by the Empire. As always, the Imperials' first thought was invasion, but the Voss people repelled them with ease.
Apparently, their Mystics can predict the future with complete precision. Word spread quickly, and gaining the Voss as allies has become a top Republic priority.
Anyone who can see the future is a good friend to have.
I can see why.
True, but we can't afford to lose sight of the overall war effort.
Do you want me to build up contacts with the locals?
Am I here to win them over?
No--that process is already well underway.
I don't believe in fortune-telling, General.
Sounds like bunk to me.
The galaxy is full of the unexplained, Major. The Jedi and Sith are proof enough of that.
Our problem is with the strategy employed by the Republic's influential diplomat, Senator Evran.
Evran is certain that the Empire will invade again, and he's withholding thousands of front-line troops to leap to Voss's defense. This cannot continue.
How can Havoc Squad free up those troops, General?
Where do I come in?
You can make their presence unnecessary.
The Imps don't like losing--I wouldn't be surprised if they tried again.
Evran could be right.
Without those troops, the Republic could lose the war long before that happens. Evran's "strategy" will cost us everything.
Evran should leave the war to the professionals.
Another stupid politician.
He's a fool playing at strategy.
Unfortunately, Evran is a close friend of the Supreme Chancellor and has his complete confidence. Even I can't overrule him now.
Our only alternative is for your team to demonstrably destroy any and all invasion vectors the Empire has left. Once Voss is "safe," we can get our troops back.
Just tell me where to begin, General.
Understood.
The Imps could have dozens of plans in the works.
Easier said than done.
Then you must render every single one of them impossible. There's no other option.
Aren't Senators supposed to be on our side?
What a waste of time.
Most of them are, but few understand the realities of war.
You'll begin by reporting to Senator Evran in his office in the Alien Enclave of Voss-Ka, the planet's mountain capital.
Evran has agreed to talk, but he still holds all the cards, Major--conduct yourself accordingly.
I won't give the Senator any reason to complain.
No problem.
Good. We have enough run-ins with the Senate as it is.
I've never failed you before, have I?
Just let me work.
Still best to keep you informed of my expectations.
Would it be that bad if Evran just disappeared, General?
I should get rid of him.
Don't be ridiculous. He may be a fool, but he's no traitor--killing him is out of the question.
Also remember that Voss is neutral territory. Imperial personnel are just as welcome as we are, so make absolutely sure that your operations remain covert.
Report back to me when the situation is dealt with. Garza out.
